page.title: 15RAG MERCHANTS - RAVENSTHORPE
page.content: The Dewsbury district has always been famous for the{rag trade,}that is, the sorting, tearing up and grinding of {waste woollen rags}which are re-worked into a coarse but serviceable cloth. Of several rag merchants in the locality{Plaistere and Hangers}are the only ones in Ravensthorpe. Their factory consists of two buildings: one where the rags are stored; the other where the rags are sorted, cut and pressed into bales.(This firm does not actually re-work the rags into cloth).Bales are then taken by wagon to various buyers and many are exported overseas to places like {Pakistan. The work, although physical and dirty, is enjoyable and workers are left alone. Wages are based on{piece-rate}_ so much per work done. There is no union and few disputes with employers.
